content:
The novel "To the Lighthouse" is a seminal work of modernist literature. Its author, Virginia Woolf, uses stream-of-consciousness narrative to explore the inner lives of her characters. The novel is set in the Hebrides, a group of islands off the coast of Scotland, and spans a decade in the lives of the Ramsay family.
QUESTION: Which literary technique is prominently used by Virginia Woolf in "To the Lighthouse"?
A. Allegory
B. Satire
C. Foreshadowing
D. Stream-of-consciousness

The literary technique prominently used by Virginia Woolf in "To the Lighthouse" is D. Stream-of-consciousness. This technique allows Woolf to delve deeply into the inner thoughts and feelings of her characters, providing readers with a profound understanding of their mental and emotional states. Through stream-of-consciousness, Woolf captures the fluidity and complexity of human consciousness, making the novel a landmark in modernist literature.
